intro: Justicia blechoides, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its foliage is often covered in a fine, silvery-white down, giving it a distinctive appearance. Justicia blechoides thrives in full sun to partial shade and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
